content.webTitle: The prize quiz set by Kinky Friedman

fields.headline: The prize quiz
fields.bodyText: Each week, a different guest quizmaster sets five questions per day, Mon-Fri. Send in answers to all 25 questions at the end of the week and the first correct entry wins a Borders £100 electronic gift card. D1 The bufflehead is a creature whose Texan population outnumbers that of any other US state. What is it? a) A prairie dog b) A sea duck c) A squirrel d) A freshwater turtle D2 Nine-banded armadillos are the state animal of Texas. Which one of these is true about them? a) At birth, four babies of the same sex are always produced b) They have one baby every two years c) They produce one litter in a lifetime d) Female babies are raised by the mother, male babies by the father D3 Pronghorns - a deer-like mammal found in Texas - have some unique, but kinda dumb, traits. Which two of the following statements are correct? a) They insist on examining at close range any unrecognised object, particularly one that is in motion b) They are bad at rearing their young c) They eat and enjoy poisonous plants found in Texas d) They lose their sight at age four D4 What happens to the female Northern earless lizard when she is carrying eggs? a) She grows ears b) She remains motionless for the entire gestation period c) She turns bright orange d) She becomes aggressive towards the male D5 How did the Atlantic croaker (fish) get it's name? a) It's extinct b) It makes a "croak" by vibrating its swim bladder c) It rubs a tooth to produce a noise d) It flexes muscles in its digestive tract · Entries must reach Prize Quiz, The Guardian, 119 Farringdon Road, London EC1R 3ER by Wednesday July 20. The winner will be notified on July 22. One entry per person. No purchase necessary. The daily online news quiz is at: Guardian.co.uk/quiz
